document.title: New Mexico Public Education Department Assessment Blueprint

01AEB1F048694C4A9F165134436CBF3B.description: Analyze the rights and obligations of citizens in the United States

588A69E0148643DA8A01C7688EFB402D.description: Describe and analyze the influence of the non-elected (e.g., staff, lobbyists, interest groups).

D24F40389E604298911458D248710F2A.description:
Compare and contrast the philosophical foundations of forms of government to understand
the purpose of the corresponding political systems (e.g., socialism, capitalism, secular,
theocratic, totalitarian).

931BF897C72C40F1A206CEE888132F5A.description: Compare and contrast the characteristics of representative governments.

2640890A27FC4CA382C8A2970CCF1A74.description: Analyze and evaluate the concept of limited government and the rule of law.

68DDBDAFB980427892C7D38F4D1164ED.description: Compare and contrast the unitary, confederal, and federal systems.

2CFA5DF3A3284FAFAE634094485A6DCB.description: Analyze the historical sources and ideals of the structure of the United States government.

E6DC57C13F1347B38966C980D9539DA1.description: Analyze the fundamental principles in the Declaration of Independence.

DC954C68340A40C68D1C2A7F88626E28.description:
Analyze and explain the philosophical foundations of the American political system in terms
of the inalienable rights of people and the purpose of government.

73A0CE7BA6CD4D7FB4A0B101012B35D6.description:
Compare and contrast structures and powers of New Mexico’s government as expressed in
the New Mexico Constitution.

3DB1A245B81D4A41B7BCFD7DCBF813D2.description:
Analyze the rights, protections, limits, and freedoms included within the United States
Constitution and Bill of Rights.

105F182823834567BE5789341BBB8D51.description:
Analyze the structure, powers, and role of the judicial branch of the United States
government, including landmark United States Supreme Court decisions.

8AB141521B914B949DA85BBC84D66D64.description:
Examine the election of the president through the nomination process, national conventions,
and Electoral College.

41AB4B2CB44A4CA0B52F9D7122B8F453.description:
Analyze the structure, powers, and role of the executive branch of the United States
government.

C08D0F80D3034E0E9FFD5795FCE82419.description:
Analyze the structure, powers, and role of the legislative branch of the United States
government.
